tip: Start in the user's home directory

options.name: --system
tip: Start a shell for the system distribution

options.name: -d
tip: U: -d, --distribution <Distro>
Run the specified distribution

options.name: -e
tip: U: -e, --exec <command>
Execute the specified command without using the default Linux shell

options.name: -u
tip: U: -u, --user <user>
Run as the specified user

options.name: --cd
tip: U: --cd <Directory>
Set the specified directory as the current working directory
If using ~, it will use the Linux user's home path
If the path starts with a / character, it will be interpreted as an absolute Linux path
Otherwise, the value must be an absolute Windows path

options.name: --debug-shell
tip: Open a WSL2 debug shell for diagnostics

options.name: --event-viewer
tip: Open the Application view of Windows Event Viewer

options.name: --export
tip: U: --export <distribution> <file_name> [options]
Export the distribution as a tar file; for standard output, the filename can be "-"
E: wsl --export ubuntu "$env:UserProfile\Desktop\export.tar"

next.name: --vhd
tip: U: --vhd <file_name>
Specify exporting the distribution as a .vhdx file

options.name: --import
tip: U: --import <distribution> <Install_location> <file_name> [options]
Import the specified tar as a new distribution; for standard input, the filename can be "-"
E: wsl --import ubuntu "$env:UserProfile\Desktop" "$env:UserProfile\Desktop\export.tar"

next.name: --version
tip: U: --version <version>
Specify the version to use for the new distribution

next.name: --vhd
tip: U: --vhd <file_name>
Specify the provided file as a .vhdx file instead of a tar file
This operation will create a copy of the .vhdx file at the specified installation location

options.name: --import-in-place
tip: U: --import-in-place <Distro> <FileName>
Import the specified .vhdx as a new distribution.
This virtual hard disk must be formatted with the ext4 file system type

options.name: --install
tip: U: --install [Options] [<distribution>]
Install Windows Subsystem for Linux (WSL) distributions for Linux
To view the list of available distributions, use wsl --list --online

next.name: --no-launch
tip: Install the distribution without launching it afterward

next.name: --web-download
tip: Download the distribution from the Internet instead of the Microsoft Store

options.name: --mount
tip: U: --mount [Options] <Disk>
Attach and mount physical or virtual disks in all WSL 2 distributions

next.name: --bare
tip: Attach the disk to WSL2 without mounting it

next.name: --name
tip: U: --name <Name>
Use a custom name for the mount point

next.name: --partition
tip: U: --partition <Index>
Partition index to mount, defaults to the entire disk if not specified

next.name: --type
tip: U: --type <Type>
File system to use when mounting the disk, defaults to ext4 if not specified

next.name: --vhd
tip: U: --vhd <Disk>
Specify that <Disk> represents a virtual hard disk

options.name: --release-notes
tip: Open a web browser to view the WSL release notes page

options.name: --set-default-version
tip: U: --set-default-version <Version>
Change the default installation version for new distributions

options.name: --set-version
tip: U: --set-version <Distribution> <Version>
Change the version of the specified distribution

options.name: --shell-type
tip: U: --shell-type <shell-type>
Execute the specified command using the provided shell type
E: -shell-type standard   --- Execute the specified command using the default Linux shell

next.name: login
tip: Execute the specified command using the default Linux shell as a login shell

next.name: none
tip: Execute the specified command without using the default Linux shell

next.name: standard
tip: Execute the specified command using the default Linux shell

options.name: --shutdown
tip: Immediately terminate all running distributions and WSL 2 lightweight virtual machines

options.name: --status
tip: Display the status of Windows Subsystem for Linux
Examples: default distribution type, default distribution, and kernel version, etc.

options.name: --system
tip: Start a shell for the system distribution

options.name: --unmount
tip: U: --unmount [Disk]
Unmount and detach a disk from all WSL2 distributions
If called without parameters, unmount and detach all disks

options.name: --unregister
tip: U: --unregister <Distribution>
Unregister the distribution and delete the root file system

options.name: --update
tip: Update Windows Subsystem for Linux (WSL) packages

next.name: --pre-release
tip: Download pre-release versions if available (implies --web-download)

next.name: --web-download
tip: Download updates from the Internet instead of the Microsoft Store

options.name: -d
tip: U: -d, --distribution <Distro>
Run the specified distribution

options.name: -e
tip: U: -e, --exec <command>
Execute the specified command without using the default Linux shell

options.name: -l
tip: U: -l, --list [options]
List distributions

next.name: --all
tip: List all distributions
Including those currently being installed or uninstalled

next.name: --running
tip: List only currently running distributions

next.name: -o
tip: U: -o, --online
Show a list of available distributions that can be installed

next.name: -q
tip: U: -q, --quiet
Show only distribution names

next.name: -v
tip: U: -v, --verbose
Show detailed information for all distributions

options.name: -s
tip: U: -s, --set-default <Distribution>
Set a distribution as the default

options.name: -t
tip: U: -t, --terminate <Distribution>
Terminate the specified distribution

options.name: -u
tip: U: -u, --user <user>
Run as the specified user

options.name: -v
tip: U: -v, --version
Check version information about WSL and its components

common_options.name: --help
tip: View a list of available options and commands in WSL.
